```
TITLE: Injectable Service Constructor with Dynamic Parameters (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Shows a service class ('HeroService') whose constructor accepts two dependencies: a logger and an authorization boolean. The method 'getHeroes' uses these to log access and filter heroes by authorization. Requires that 'Logger' is provided, and demonstrates how to inject primitive values via factory providers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/dependency-injection-providers.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
class HeroService {
  constructor(
    private logger: Logger,
    private isAuthorized: boolean) { }

  getHeroes() {
    const auth = this.isAuthorized ? 'authorized' : 'unauthorized';
    this.logger.log(`Getting heroes for ${auth} user.`);
    return HEROES.filter(hero => this.isAuthorized || !hero.isSecret);
  }
}
```

TITLE: TypeScript Interface Definitions for Angular Service Worker Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive type definitions for Angular Service Worker configuration. Includes interfaces for AssetGroup, Config, DataGroup, and Filesystem, along with a Generator class for processing service worker configurations. These interfaces define the structure for creating service worker configurations in Angular applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/service-worker/config/index.api.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// @public
export interface AssetGroup {
    // (undocumented)
    cacheQueryOptions?: Pick<CacheQueryOptions, 'ignoreSearch'>;
    // (undocumented)
    installMode?: 'prefetch' | 'lazy';
    // (undocumented)
    name: string;
    // (undocumented)
    resources: {
        files?: Glob[];
        urls?: Glob[];
    };
    // (undocumented)
    updateMode?: 'prefetch' | 'lazy';
}

// @public
export interface Config {
    // (undocumented)
    appData?: {};
    // (undocumented)
    applicationMaxAge?: Duration;
    // (undocumented)
    assetGroups?: AssetGroup[];
    // (undocumented)
    dataGroups?: DataGroup[];
    // (undocumented)
    index: string;
    // (undocumented)
    navigationRequestStrategy?: 'freshness' | 'performance';
    // (undocumented)
    navigationUrls?: string[];
}

// @public
export interface DataGroup {
    // (undocumented)
    cacheConfig: {
        maxSize: number;
        maxAge: Duration;
        timeout?: Duration;
        refreshAhead?: Duration;
        strategy?: 'freshness' | 'performance';
        cacheOpaqueResponses?: boolean;
    };
    // (undocumented)
    cacheQueryOptions?: Pick<CacheQueryOptions, 'ignoreSearch'>;
    // (undocumented)
    name: string;
    // (undocumented)
    urls: Glob[];
    // (undocumented)
    version?: number;
}

// @public (undocumented)
export type Duration = string;

// @public
export interface Filesystem {
    // (undocumented)
    hash(file: string): Promise<string>;
    // (undocumented)
    list(dir: string): Promise<string[]>;
    // (undocumented)
    read(file: string): Promise<string>;
    // (undocumented)
    write(file: string, contents: string): Promise<void>;
}

// @public
class Generator_2 {
    constructor(fs: Filesystem, baseHref: string);
    // (undocumented)
    readonly fs: Filesystem;
    // (undocumented)
    process(config: Config): Promise<Object>;
}
export { Generator_2 as Generator }

// @public (undocumented)
export type Glob = string;

// (No @packageDocumentation comment for this package)
```

TITLE: Enabling i18n Support for Angular Hydration

By default, components using i18n blocks skip hydration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/hydration.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import {
  bootstrapApplication,
  provideClientHydration,
  withI18nSupport,
} from '@angular/platform-browser';
...

bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, {
  providers: [provideClientHydration(withI18nSupport())]
});
```

TITLE: Defining Filter Animation Trigger in Angular TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Defines the `filterAnimation` trigger in an Angular component's `animations` metadata. It includes transitions for elements entering and leaving the DOM, demonstrating skipping initial animations, setting styles, animating properties over time, and staggering animations for multiple elements using `query` and `stagger`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/animations/complex-sequences.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
@Component({
  selector: 'app-hero-list-page',
  templateUrl: 'hero-list-page.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./hero-list-page.component.css'],
  animations: [
    trigger('filterAnimation', [
      transition(':enter, * => 0', []), // Skip animation on load or when list becomes empty

      transition(':leave', [
        style({ opacity: 1, width: '*' }),
        animate('300ms ease-out', style({ opacity: 0, width: '0px' }))
      ]),

      transition('0 => *', [
        query(':enter', [
          style({ opacity: 0, width: '0px' }),
          stagger(50, [
            animate('300ms ease-in', style({ opacity: 1, width: '*' }))
          ])
        ], { optional: true })
      ])
    ])
  ]
})
```

TITLE: Using fill Attribute for Background Image Behavior in Angular Template
DESCRIPTION: When you cannot specify fixed `width` and `height` for an image, use the `fill` attribute on the `<img>` tag with `ngSrc`. This makes the image behave like a background image, stretching to fill its containing element. The parent container *must* have CSS `position` set to `relative`, `fixed`, or `absolute` for `fill` to work correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/11-optimizing-images/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: angular-html
CODE:
```
<div class="image-container"> //Container div has 'position: "relative"'
  <img ngSrc="www.example.com/image.png" fill />
</div>
```

TITLE: NavigationStart Router Event Class in Angular (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Represents the beginning of a router navigation cycle. This is the first event emitted when a navigation is triggered by the user (link click), programmatically (`router.navigate`), or by browser history navigation. It provides the navigation ID, target URL, trigger type, and potentially restored state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/router/index.api.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
export class NavigationStart extends RouterEvent {
    constructor(
    id: number,
    url: string,
    navigationTrigger?: NavigationTrigger,
    restoredState?: {
        [k: string]: any;
        navigationId: number;
    } | null);
    navigationTrigger?: NavigationTrigger;
    restoredState?: {
        [k: string]: any;
        navigationId: number;
    } | null;
    toString(): string;
    readonly type = EventType.NavigationStart;
}
```

TITLE: Example Translated XLIFF Unit for ICU Plural Expression
DESCRIPTION: Shows how an ICU plural expression, originally defined in a component template, is represented and translated within an XLIFF `<trans-unit>`. The `<source>` tag contains the entire ICU plural expression structure. The `<target>` tag contains the translated version, including translated text for each plural case (`=0`, `=1`, `other`) and preserving the placeholder (`<x id="INTERPOLATION".../>`) for the dynamic value (`minutes`).

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<trans-unit id="5a134dee893586d02bffc9611056b9cadf9ab341" datatype="html">
  <source>{VAR_PLURAL, plural, =0 {just now} =1 {one minute ago} other {<x id="INTERPOLATION" equiv-text="{{minutes}}"/> minutes ago} }</source>
  <target>{VAR_PLURAL, plural, =0 {Ã  l&apos;instant} =1 {il y a une minute} other {il y a <x id="INTERPOLATION" equiv-text="{{minutes}}"/> minutes} }</target>
</trans-unit>
```

TITLE: Resetting Database and Fetching Data Sequence - Angular In-Memory Web API - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet shows a chained sequence of HTTP requests using the Angular HTTP client. It resets the in-memory database collections with a 'clear' option, waits for completion, and then retrieves the 'heroes' collection. The implementation uses .concatMap and .map operators to process the observable stream and handles the final data in a subscription. Dependencies include RxJS for observable chaining and the Angular HTTP client for requests. Key parameters: the 'clear' option passed in the reset request, and the data type for heroes. The input expects command endpoints and returns observable streams.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/misc/angular-in-memory-web-api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
http
  // Reset the database collections with the `clear` option
  .post('commands/resetDb', { clear: true }))

  // when command finishes, get heroes
  .concatMap(
    ()=> http.get<Data>('api/heroes')
        .map(data => data.data as Hero[])
  )

  // execute the request sequence and
  // do something with the heroes
  .subscribe(...)
```

TITLE: Executing Code After Application Stability
DESCRIPTION: Pattern for safely executing code once the application becomes stable by subscribing to applicationRef.isStable observable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/errors/NG0506.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
class SimpleComponent {
  constructor() {
    const applicationRef = inject(ApplicationRef);

    applicationRef.isStable.pipe( first((isStable) => isStable) ).subscribe(() => {
      // Note that we don't need to use `runOutsideAngular` because `isStable`
      // emits events outside of the Angular zone when it's truthy (falsy values
      // are emitted inside the Angular zone).
      setTimeout(() => { ... });
    });
  }
}
```

TITLE: Basic Signal Implementation with Shipping Options
DESCRIPTION: Example of a component using regular signals to manage shipping options selection, highlighting potential issues when shipping options change.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/linked-signal.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Component({/* ... */})
export class ShippingMethodPicker {
  shippingOptions: Signal<ShippingMethod[]> = getShippingOptions();

  // Select the first shipping option by default.
  selectedOption = signal(this.shippingOptions()[0]);

  changeShipping(newOptionIndex: number) {
    this.selectedOption.set(this.shippingOptions()[newOptionIndex]);
  }
}
```

DESCRIPTION: Shows an interceptor that checks the value of a custom HttpContextToken in the incoming request and conditionally applies caching logic based on its value. Dependencies include a defined CACHING_ENABLED token, HttpClient, and potentially caching infrastructure. If CACHING_ENABLED is true, custom response logic is executed; otherwise, the request proceeds to the next handler.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/interceptors.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
export function cachingInterceptor(req: HttpRequest<unknown>, next: HttpHandlerFn): Observable<HttpEvent<unknown>> {\n  if (req.context.get(CACHING_ENABLED)) {\n    // apply caching logic\n    return ...;\n  } else {\n    // caching has been disabled for this request\n    return next(req);\n  }\n}
```

TITLE: Handling Request Abort in Angular Resource Loader - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This example illustrates how to utilize the `abortSignal` provided within the resource loader function. It demonstrates passing the signal to a native `fetch` request, allowing the fetch operation to be cancelled automatically if the resource's parameters change before the request completes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/resource.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
const userId: Signal<string> = getUserId();

const userResource = resource({
  params: () => ({id: userId()}),
  loader: ({request, abortSignal}): Promise<User> => {
    // fetch cancels any outstanding HTTP requests when the given `AbortSignal`
    // indicates that the request has been aborted.
    return fetch(`users/${request.id}`, {signal: abortSignal});
  },
});
```

TITLE: Implementing Filtered Menu Harness in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a menu component harness with filtering capabilities using HarnessPredicate. Includes interfaces for filter options and implementation of filtering based on trigger text and menu item text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/creating-component-harnesses.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface MyMenuHarnessFilters extends BaseHarnessFilters {
  /** Filters based on the trigger text for the menu. */
  triggerText?: string | RegExp;
}

interface MyMenuItemHarnessFilters extends BaseHarnessFilters {
  /** Filters based on the text of the menu item. */
  text?: string | RegExp;
}

class MyMenuHarness extends ComponentHarness {
  static hostSelector = 'my-menu';

  /** Creates a `HarnessPredicate` used to locate a particular `MyMenuHarness`. */
  static with(options: MyMenuHarnessFilters): HarnessPredicate<MyMenuHarness> {
    return new HarnessPredicate(MyMenuHarness, options)
        .addOption('trigger text', options.triggerText,
            (harness, text) => HarnessPredicate.stringMatches(harness.getTriggerText(), text));
  }

  protected getPopupHarness = this.locatorFor(MyPopupHarness);

  /** Gets the text of the menu trigger. */
  async getTriggerText(): Promise<string> {
    const popupHarness = await this.getPopupHarness();
    return popupHarness.getTriggerText();
  }
  ...
}

class MyMenuItemHarness extends ComponentHarness {
  static hostSelector = 'my-menu-item';

  /** Creates a `HarnessPredicate` used to locate a particular `MyMenuItemHarness`. */
  static with(options: MyMenuItemHarnessFilters): HarnessPredicate<MyMenuItemHarness> {
    return new HarnessPredicate(MyMenuItemHarness, options)
        .addOption('text', options.text,
            (harness, text) => HarnessPredicate.stringMatches(harness.getText(), text));
  }

  /** Gets the text of the menu item. */
  async getText(): Promise<string> {
    const host = await this.host();
    return host.text();
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Keyframe Animations (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the `keyframes()` function within an animation definition to create multi-step animations. This allows for sequential style changes over a single timing segment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/animations/transition-and-triggers.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { trigger, state, style, animate, transition, keyframes } from '@angular/animations';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-status-slider',
  template: `
    <div [@status]="status">Status: {{ status }}</div>
    <button (click)="changeStatus()">Change Status</button>
  `,
  animations: [
    trigger('status', [
      state('active', style({ backgroundColor: 'green' })),
      state('inactive', style({ backgroundColor: 'red' })),
      transition('* => active', [
        animate('2s', keyframes([
          style({ backgroundColor: 'blue', offset: 0 }),
          style({ backgroundColor: 'purple', offset: 0.5 }),
          style({ backgroundColor: 'green', offset: 1 })
        ]))
      ]),
      transition('* => inactive', [
         animate('2s', keyframes([
          style({ backgroundColor: 'orange', offset: 0 }),
          style({ backgroundColor: 'yellow', offset: 0.5 }),
          style({ backgroundColor: 'red', offset: 1 })
        ]))
      ])
    ])
  ]
})
export class StatusSliderComponent {
  status = 'inactive';

  changeStatus() {
    this.status = this.status === 'inactive' ? 'active' : 'inactive';
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining AbstractControl Class
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the AbstractControl class, which is the base class for form controls in Angular. It includes methods for validation, state management, and value updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/forms/index.api.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
export abstract class AbstractControl<TValue = any, TRawValue extends TValue = TValue> {
    constructor(validators: ValidatorFn | ValidatorFn[] | null, asyncValidators: AsyncValidatorFn | AsyncValidatorFn[] | null);
    addAsyncValidators(validators: AsyncValidatorFn | AsyncValidatorFn[]): void;
    addValidators(validators: ValidatorFn | ValidatorFn[]): void;
    get asyncValidator(): AsyncValidatorFn | null;
    set asyncValidator(asyncValidatorFn: AsyncValidatorFn | null);
    clearAsyncValidators(): void;
    clearValidators(): void;
    get dirty(): boolean;
    disable(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    get disabled(): boolean;
    enable(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    get enabled(): boolean;
    readonly errors: ValidationErrors | null;
    readonly events: Observable<ControlEvent<TValue>>;
    get<P extends string | readonly (string | number)[]>(path: P): AbstractControl<ÉµGetProperty<TRawValue, P>> | null;
    get<P extends string | Array<string | number>>(path: P): AbstractControl<ÉµGetProperty<TRawValue, P>> | null;
    getError(errorCode: string, path?: Array<string | number> | string): any;
    getRawValue(): any;
    hasAsyncValidator(validator: AsyncValidatorFn): boolean;
    hasError(errorCode: string, path?: Array<string | number> | string): boolean;
    hasValidator(validator: ValidatorFn): boolean;
    get invalid(): boolean;
    markAllAsDirty(opts?: {
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAllAsTouched(opts?: {
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAsDirty(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAsPending(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAsPristine(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAsTouched(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    markAsUntouched(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    get parent(): FormGroup | FormArray | null;
    abstract patchValue(value: TValue, options?: Object): void;
    get pending(): boolean;
    get pristine(): boolean;
    removeAsyncValidators(validators: AsyncValidatorFn | AsyncValidatorFn[]): void;
    removeValidators(validators: ValidatorFn | ValidatorFn[]): void;
    abstract reset(value?: TValue, options?: Object): void;
    get root(): AbstractControl;
    setAsyncValidators(validators: AsyncValidatorFn | AsyncValidatorFn[] | null): void;
    setErrors(errors: ValidationErrors | null, opts?: {
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    setParent(parent: FormGroup | FormArray | null): void;
    setValidators(validators: ValidatorFn | ValidatorFn[] | null): void;
    abstract setValue(value: TRawValue, options?: Object): void;
    get status(): FormControlStatus;
    readonly statusChanges: Observable<FormControlStatus>;
    get touched(): boolean;
    get untouched(): boolean;
    get updateOn(): FormHooks;
    updateValueAndValidity(opts?: {
        onlySelf?: boolean;
        emitEvent?: boolean;
    }): void;
    get valid(): boolean;
    get validator(): ValidatorFn | null;
    set validator(validatorFn: ValidatorFn | null);
    readonly value: TValue;
    readonly valueChanges: Observable<TValue>;
}
```

TITLE: Demonstrating linkedSignal Behavior with Array Values
DESCRIPTION: A simple example showing how linkedSignal values automatically update when the source signal changes, while preserving manual selections until the source changes.

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const shippingOptions = signal(['Ground', 'Air', 'Sea']);
const selectedOption = linkedSignal(() => shippingOptions()[0]);
console.log(selectedOption()); // 'Ground'

selectedOption.set(shippingOptions()[2]);
console.log(selectedOption()); // 'Sea'

shippingOptions.set(['Email', 'Will Call', 'Postal service']);
console.log(selectedOption()); // 'Email'
```

TITLE: Implementing Parameterized Routes in Angular SSR
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure prerendered routes with dynamic parameters using getPrerenderParams. The example shows how to generate multiple static paths based on dynamic IDs from a service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/ssr.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// app.routes.server.ts
import { RenderMode, ServerRoute } from '@angular/ssr';

export const serverRoutes: ServerRoute[] = [
  {
    path: 'post/:id',
    renderMode: RenderMode.Prerender,
    async getPrerenderParams() {
      const dataService = inject(PostService);
      const ids = await dataService.getIds(); // Assuming this returns ['1', '2', '3']

      return ids.map(id => ({ id })); // Transforms IDs into an array of objects for prerendering

      // This will prerender the paths: `/post/1`, `/post/2` and `/post/3`
    },
  },
];

    backgroundColor: 'yellow'
  })),

    height: '100px',
    opacity: 0.5,
    backgroundColor: 'green'
  })),

  ]),
  transition('closed => open', [

  ])
]);

```
TITLE: Handling Unrecoverable State in Angular Service Worker
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to handle unrecoverable states in an Angular service worker application. It subscribes to the unrecoverable event from SwUpdate and logs the error, then reloads the page to recover from the broken state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/ecosystem/service-workers/communications.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Injectable()
export class HandleUnrecoverableStateService {
  constructor(updates: SwUpdate) {
    updates.unrecoverable.subscribe(event => {
      console.error(
        'An error occurred that we cannot recover from:\n' +
        event.reason +
        '\n\nPlease reload the page.'
      );
      // Reload the page
      document.location.reload();
    });
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining and Using API via Lightweight Injection Token in Angular (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript example extends the lightweight injection token pattern by adding an abstract `doSomething` method to `LibHeaderToken`. `LibHeaderComponent` provides the concrete implementation. `LibCardComponent` queries for `LibHeaderToken` and safely calls the `doSomething` method on the header if it exists (`this.header?.doSomething()`), allowing interaction without preventing tree-shaking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/lightweight-injection-tokens.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
abstract class LibHeaderToken {
  abstract doSomething(): void;
}

@Component({
  selector: 'lib-header',
  providers: [
    {provide: LibHeaderToken, useExisting: LibHeaderComponent}
  ]
  â€¦,
})
class LibHeaderComponent extends LibHeaderToken {
  doSomething(): void {
    // Concrete implementation of `doSomething`
  }
}

@Component({
  selector: 'lib-card',
  â€¦,
})
class LibCardComponent implement AfterContentInit {
  @ContentChild(LibHeaderToken) header: LibHeaderToken|null = null;

  ngAfterContentInit(): void {
    if (this.header !== null) {
      this.header?.doSomething();
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Handling Animation Callback Events in Component (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Provides a TypeScript method that receives the `AnimationEvent` object from animation callbacks. This method logs details about the animation event to the console, useful for debugging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/animations/transition-and-triggers.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { trigger, state, style, animate, transition, AnimationEvent } from '@angular/animations';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-open-close',
  templateUrl: './open-close.component.html',
  animations: [
    trigger('openClose', [
      state('open', style({ height: '200px', opacity: 1, backgroundColor: 'yellow' })),
      state('closed', style({ height: '100px', opacity: 0.5, backgroundColor: 'green' })),
      transition('open => closed', [ animate('1s ease-out') ]),
      transition('closed => open', [ animate('0.5s ease-in') ])
    ])
  ]
})
export class OpenCloseComponent {
  isOpen = true;

  toggle() {
    this.isOpen = !this.isOpen;
  }

  onAnimationEvent(event: AnimationEvent) {
    console.warn(`Animation Trigger: ${event.triggerName}`);
    console.warn(`State: ${event.fromState} => ${event.toState}`);
    console.warn(`Phase: ${event.phaseName}`);
    console.warn(`Total time: ${event.totalTime}`);
    console.warn(`Element: ${event.element}`);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Referencing Multiple Angular TypeScript ng-template with ViewChild by Name
DESCRIPTION: This Angular TypeScript snippet shows how to query for multiple template fragments in a component when they are identified by template reference variables (e.g., #fragmentOne, #fragmentTwo). Using @ViewChild with the variable name and the {read: TemplateRef} option allows accessing specific fragment references in the component class.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/ng-template.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: angular-ts
CODE:
```
@Component({
  /* ... */,
  template: `
    <p>This is a normal element</p>

    <ng-template #fragmentOne>
      <p>This is one template fragment</p>
    </ng-template>

    <ng-template #fragmentTwo>
      <p>This is another template fragment</p>
    </ng-template>
  `,
})
export class ComponentWithFragment {
  // When querying by name, you can use the `read` option to specify that you want to get the
  // TemplateRef object associated with the element.
  @ViewChild('fragmentOne', {read: TemplateRef}) fragmentOne: TemplateRef<unknown> | undefined;
  @ViewChild('fragmentTwo', {read: TemplateRef}) fragmentTwo: TemplateRef<unknown> | undefined;
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Core Logic for a Custom Structural Directive (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Implements the `ngOnInit` lifecycle hook in `SelectDirective`. Inside `ngOnInit`, it asynchronously loads data using the `selectFrom` input's `load()` method. Once data is retrieved, it uses `viewContainerRef.createEmbeddedView` to instantiate the associated template (`templateRef`). It passes the loaded data to the template's context using the special `$implicit` key, making the data accessible via a `let data` declaration in the template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/structural-directives.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```

```
TITLE: Configuring Angular Extended Diagnostics Severity in tsconfig
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to configure the severity of Angular extended diagnostics within the `angularCompilerOptions` section of the `tsconfig.json` file. Requires `strictTemplates` to be enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/extended-diagnostics/overview.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "extendedDiagnostics": {
      // The categories to use for specific diagnostics.
      "checks": {
        // Maps check name to its category.
        "invalidBananaInBox": "suppress"
      },

      // The category to use for any diagnostics not listed in `checks` above.
      "defaultCategory": "error"
    }

}
}

```
TITLE: Implementing Advanced Custom Image Loader with LoaderParams
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a custom loader function that handles both basic image parameters and additional CDN features through loaderParams, such as rounded corners.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/image-optimization.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const myCustomLoader = (config: ImageLoaderConfig) => {
  let url = `https://example.com/images/${config.src}?`;
  let queryParams = [];
  if (config.width) {
    queryParams.push(`w=${config.width}`);
  }
  if (config.loaderParams?.roundedCorners) {
    queryParams.push('mask=corners&corner-radius=5');
  }
  return url + queryParams.join('&');
};
```

TITLE: Creating Trusted Video URL in Angular Component
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a trusted resource URL for a YouTube video ID using DomSanitizer's bypassSecurityTrustResourceUrl method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/security.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
constructor(private sanitizer: DomSanitizer) {}

// update the video URL when the user changes the ID
updateVideoUrl(id: string) {
  // Appending an ID to a YouTube URL is safe.
  // Always make sure to construct SafeValue objects as
  // close as possible to the input data so
  // that it's easier to check if the value is safe.
  this.videoUrl = 'https://www.youtube.com/embed/' + id;
  return this.sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustResourceUrl(this.videoUrl);
}
```

TITLE: Displaying Validation Errors in Angular Template-Driven Forms (HTML)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to display validation error messages in an Angular template-driven form. It uses the `ngModel` export (`#name="ngModel"`) to check the control's `valid`, `dirty`, and `touched` states. Standard HTML attributes (`required`, `minlength`) and a custom validator directive (`forbiddenName`) are applied. Error messages for `required`, `minlength`, and `forbiddenName` are conditionally displayed using `*ngIf` based on the control's validity and interaction state (dirty or touched).
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<label for="name">Name</label>
<input type="text" id="name" class="form-control" required minlength="4" appForbiddenName="bob"
      name="name" [(ngModel)]="model.name" #name="ngModel" >

<div *ngIf="name.invalid && (name.dirty || name.touched)"
    class="alert alert-danger">

  <div *ngIf="name.errors?.['required']">
    Name is required.
  </div>
  <div *ngIf="name.errors?.['minlength']">
    Name must be at least 4 characters long.
  </div>
  <div *ngIf="name.errors?.['forbiddenName']">
    Name cannot be Bob.
  </div>

</div>
```

TITLE: Controlling View Transitions with onViewTransitionCreated Callback
DESCRIPTION: Implementation example that uses the onViewTransitionCreated callback to conditionally skip transitions. This example from angular.dev skips transitions when only fragment or query parameters change in the URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/animations/route-animations.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
withViewTransitions({
 onViewTransitionCreated: ({transition}) => {
   const router = inject(Router);
   const targetUrl = router.getCurrentNavigation()!.finalUrl!;
   // Skip the transition if the only thing 
   // changing is the fragment and queryParams
   const config = { 
     paths: 'exact', 
     matrixParams: 'exact',
     fragment: 'ignored',
     queryParams: 'ignored',
   };

   if (router.isActive(targetUrl, config)) {
     transition.skipTransition();
   }
 },
}),
```

TITLE: Configuring Custom Equality Comparison for linkedSignal
DESCRIPTION: Examples demonstrating how to use custom equality functions with linkedSignal to optimize change detection based on specific properties rather than full object equality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/linked-signal.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const activeUser = signal({id: 123, name: 'Morgan', isAdmin: true});

const activeUserEditCopy = linkedSignal(() => activeUser(), {
  // Consider the user as the same if it's the same `id`.
  equal: (a, b) => a.id === b.id,
});

// Or, if separating `source` and `computation`
const activeUserEditCopy = linkedSignal({
  source: activeUser,
  computation: user => user,
  equal: (a, b) => a.id === b.id,
});
```

TITLE: Using Animation Callbacks (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a component with an animation trigger that emits start and done events. The TypeScript code sets up the animation trigger definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/animations/transition-and-triggers.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { trigger, state, style, animate, transition } from '@angular/animations';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-open-close',
  templateUrl: './open-close.component.html',
  animations: [
    trigger('openClose', [
      state('open', style({ height: '200px', opacity: 1, backgroundColor: 'yellow' })),
      state('closed', style({ height: '100px', opacity: 0.5, backgroundColor: 'green' })),
      transition('open => closed', [ animate('1s ease-out') ]),
      transition('closed => open', [ animate('0.5s ease-in') ])
    ])
  ]
})
export class OpenCloseComponent {
  isOpen = true;

  toggle() {
    this.isOpen = !this.isOpen;
  }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Impure Angular Pipe

SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/pipes.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: angular-ts
CODE:
```
import { Pipe, PipeTransform } from '@angular/core';

@Pipe({
  name: 'joinNamesImpure',
  pure: false,
})
export class JoinNamesImpurePipe implements PipeTransform {
  transform(names: string[]): string {
    return names.join();
  }
}

interface HttpRequest<T> {
    headers?: HttpHeaders;
    context?: HttpContext;
    reportProgress?: boolean;
    params?: HttpParams;

        includeHeaders?: string[];
    } | boolean;

        headers?: HttpHeaders;

        keepalive?: boolean;
        transferCache?: {
            includeHeaders?: string[];
        } | boolean;

        method?: string;
        url?: string;

            [name: string]: string | string[];
        };
        setParams?: {
            [param: string]: string;
        };

```
TITLE: Rendering Angular TypeScript ng-template with ViewContainerRef
DESCRIPTION: This Angular TypeScript snippet illustrates rendering a template fragment dynamically using ViewContainerRef. It shows two components: one declaring a fragment and passing its reference as an Input, and another injecting ViewContainerRef to create an embedded view from the fragment reference on a button click.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/ng-template.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: angular-ts
CODE:
```
@Component({
  /* ... */,
  selector: 'component-with-fragment',
  template: `
    <h2>Component with a fragment</h2>
    <ng-template #myFragment>
      <p>This is the fragment</p>
    </ng-template>
    <my-outlet [fragment]="myFragment" />
  `,
})
export class ComponentWithFragment { }

@Component({
  /* ... */,
  selector: 'my-outlet',
  template: `<button (click)="showFragment()">Show</button>`,
})
export class MyOutlet {
  private viewContainer = inject(ViewContainerRef);
  @Input() fragment: TemplateRef<unknown> | undefined;

  showFragment() {
    if (this.fragment) {
      this.viewContainer.createEmbeddedView(this.fragment);
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Demonstrating Component Selector Collision in Angular
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how selector collision occurs when two different components (StrokedBtnComponent and RaisedBtnComponent) are applied to the same button element through attribute selectors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/errors/NG0300.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
  selector: '[stroked-button]',
  templateUrl: './stroked-button.component.html',
})
export class StrokedBtnComponent {}

@Component({
  selector: '[raised-button]',
  templateUrl: './raised-button.component.html',
})
export class RaisedBtnComponent {}


@Component({
  selector: 'app-root',
  template: `
  <!-- This node has 2 selectors: stroked-button and raised-button, and both match a different component: StrokedBtnComponent, and RaisedBtnComponent , so NG0300 will be raised  -->
  <button stroked-button  raised-button></button>
  `,
})
export class AppComponent {}

```
TITLE: Creating Async Validator Directive for Angular Template-Driven Forms
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a custom directive for an async validator to be used in template-driven forms, registering it with NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Directive({
  selector: '[appUniqueRole]',
  providers: [{
    provide: NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS,
    useExisting: UniqueRoleValidatorDirective,
    multi: true
  }]
})
export class UniqueRoleValidatorDirective implements AsyncValidator {
  constructor(private validator: UniqueRoleValidator) {}

  validate(control: AbstractControl): Promise<ValidationErrors | null> | Observable<ValidationErrors | null> {
    return this.validator.validate(control);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Demonstrating Component Retention via Constructor Injection and @ContentChild (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript example defines `MyComponent` which references `OtherComponent` in two ways: via optional constructor injection (`constructor(@Optional() other: OtherComponent)`) and via a content query (`@ContentChild(OtherComponent)`). Both usages create value-position references to `OtherComponent`, preventing it from being tree-shaken even if not explicitly used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/lightweight-injection-tokens.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
class MyComponent {
  constructor(@Optional() other: OtherComponent) {}

  @ContentChild(OtherComponent) other: OtherComponent|null;
}

        }
      },
```

TITLE: Re-entering NgZone for Event Handling
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to re-enter the Angular zone when dispatching events from code running outside NgZone to ensure proper change detection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/best-practices/runtime-performance/zone-pollution.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component, NgZone, OnInit, output } from '@angular/core';
import * as Plotly from 'plotly.js-dist-min';

@Component(...)
class AppComponent implements OnInit {
  private ngZone = inject(NgZone);

  plotlyClick = output<Plotly.PlotMouseEvent>();

  ngOnInit() {
    this.ngZone.runOutsideAngular(() => {
      this.createPlotly();
    });
  }

  private async createPlotly() {
    const plotly = await Plotly.newPlot('chart', data);

    plotly.on('plotly_click', (event: Plotly.PlotMouseEvent) => {
      this.ngZone.run(() => {
        this.plotlyClick.emit(event);
      });
    });
  }
}
```

TITLE: Typing Generic Template Context in Angular Structural Directive
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of ngTemplateContextGuard to properly type the context provided to a template in a generic structural directive, ensuring type safety with generic data sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/structural-directives.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Declare an interface for the template context:
export interface SelectTemplateContext<T> {
  $implicit: T;
}

@Directive(...)
export class SelectDirective<T> {
  // The directive's generic type `T` will be inferred from the `DataSource` type
  // passed to the input.
  @Input({required: true}) selectFrom!: DataSource<T>;

  // Narrow the type of the context using the generic type of the directive.
  static ngTemplateContextGuard<T>(dir: SelectDirective<T>, ctx: any): ctx is SelectTemplateContext<T> {
    // As before the guard body is not used at runtime, and included only to avoid
    // TypeScript errors.
    return true;
  }
}

    opacity: 0.5,

```
TITLE: Creating Component-level Service Provider for Isolated Editing Sessions in Angular
DESCRIPTION: A component that uses a component-scoped service instance to manage an individual tax return editing session. This demonstrates how to create isolated state management for multiple concurrent editing sessions with component-level providers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/hierarchical-dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_47

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component, EventEmitter, Input, Output } from '@angular/core';
import { HeroTaxReturn } from './hero';
import { HeroTaxReturnService } from './hero-tax-return.service';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-hero-tax-return',
  templateUrl: './hero-tax-return.component.html',
  styleUrls: [ './hero-tax-return.component.css' ],
  providers: [ HeroTaxReturnService ]
})
export class HeroTaxReturnComponent {
  message = '';

  @Output() close = new EventEmitter<void>();

  get taxReturn(): HeroTaxReturn {
    return this.heroTaxReturnService.taxReturn;
  }

  @Input()
  set taxReturn(htr: HeroTaxReturn) {
    this.heroTaxReturnService.taxReturn = htr;
  }

  private heroTaxReturnService = inject(HeroTaxReturnService);

  onCanceled()  {
    this.flashMessage('Canceled');
    this.heroTaxReturnService.restoreTaxReturn();
  }

  onClose() { this.close.emit(); }

  onSaved() {
    this.flashMessage('Saved');
    this.heroTaxReturnService.saveTaxReturn();
  }

  flashMessage(msg: string) {
    this.message = msg;
    setTimeout(() => this.message = '', 500);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Checking for Updates with SwUpdate in Angular
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a service that checks for updates using the SwUpdate service in Angular. It waits for the application to stabilize before checking for updates to avoid interfering with initial page rendering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/ecosystem/service-workers/communications.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Injectable()
export class CheckForUpdateService {
  constructor(appRef: ApplicationRef, updates: SwUpdate) {
    // Allow the app to stabilize first, before starting
    // polling for updates with `interval()`.
    const appIsStable$ = appRef.isStable.pipe(first(isStable => isStable === true));
    const everySixHours$ = interval(6 * 60 * 60 * 1000);
    const everySixHoursOnceAppIsStable$ = concat(appIsStable$, everySixHours$);

    everySixHoursOnceAppIsStable$.subscribe(async () => {
      try {
        const updateFound = await updates.checkForUpdate();
        console.log(updateFound ? 'A new version is available.' : 'Already on the latest version.');
      } catch (err) {
        console.error('Failed to check for updates:', err);
      }
    });
  }
}
```

DESCRIPTION: Shows different approaches to binding dependencies: to a class, value, or factory, including sugar syntax and aliasing tokens. TITLE: Refactored Angular Component Without Unused Imports - TypeScript (After Migration)
```
```
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet displays the component after running the migration tool. TITLE: Advanced linkedSignal with Previous State Preservation
```
```
DESCRIPTION: Example using linkedSignal with separate source and computation parameters to maintain user selections when possible, by preserving the previously selected item if it still exists in the updated options list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/linked-signal.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface ShippingMethod {
  id: number;
  name: string;
}

@Component({/* ... */})
export class ShippingMethodPicker {
  constructor() {
    this.changeShipping(2);
    this.changeShippingOptions();
    console.log(this.selectedOption()); // {"id":2,"name":"Postal Service"}
  }

  shippingOptions = signal<ShippingMethod[]>([
    { id: 0, name: 'Ground' },
    { id: 1, name: 'Air' },
    { id: 2, name: 'Sea' },
  ]);

  selectedOption = linkedSignal<ShippingMethod[], ShippingMethod>({
    // `selectedOption` is set to the `computation` result whenever this `source` changes.
    source: this.shippingOptions,
    computation: (newOptions, previous) => {
      // If the newOptions contain the previously selected option, preserve that selection.
      // Otherwise, default to the first option.
      return (
        newOptions.find((opt) => opt.id === previous?.value.id) ?? newOptions[0]
      );
    },
  });

  changeShipping(index: number) {
    this.selectedOption.set(this.shippingOptions()[index]);
  }

  changeShippingOptions() {
    this.shippingOptions.set([
      { id: 0, name: 'Email' },
      { id: 1, name: 'Sea' },
      { id: 2, name: 'Postal Service' },
    ]);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Handling Identifier Collisions in Angular Inputs - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how Angular's input utility interacts with local and parent scope collisions, variable shadowing, and variable naming corner cases. The snippet explores scenarios where component properties shadow variables in other scopes, including nested functions. Depends on Angular's Component decorator and the custom input function. Key functions demonstrate input accesses, type checks, and safe use when variable collisions occur.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
/**
 * @license
 * Copyright Google LLC All Rights Reserved.
 *
 * Use of this source code is governed by an MIT-style license that can be
 * found in the LICENSE file at https://angular.dev/license
 */

// tslint:disable

import {Component, input} from '@angular/core';

const complex = 'some global variable';

@Component({template: ''})
class MyComp {
  readonly name = input<string | null>(null);
  readonly complex = input<string | null>(null);

  valid() {
    const name = this.name();
    if (name) {
      name.charAt(0);
    }
  }

  // Input read cannot be stored in a variable: `name`.
  simpleLocalCollision() {
    const name = 'some other name';
    const nameValue = this.name();
    if (nameValue) {
      nameValue.charAt(0);
    }
  }

  // `this.complex` should conflict with the file-level `complex` variable,
  // and result in a suffix variable.
  complexParentCollision() {
    const complexValue = this.complex();
    if (complexValue) {
      complexValue.charAt(0);
    }
  }

  nestedShadowing() {
    const nameValue = this.name();
    if (nameValue) {
      nameValue.charAt(0);
    }

    function nested() {
      const name = '';
    }
  }
}

```

TITLE: Demonstrating Useless Nullish Coalescing in Angular Template (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an Angular component where the nullish coalescing operator is used unnecessarily in the template because the 'username' property is typed as a non-nullable string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/extended-diagnostics/NG8102.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import {Component} from '@angular/core';

@Component({
  // Template displays `username` if present, falls back to 'root' if it is
  // `null` or `undefined`.
  template: `<div>{{ username ?? 'root' }}</div>`,
})
class MyComponent {
  // `username` is declared as a `string` which *cannot* be `null` or
  // `undefined`.
  username: string = 'Angelino';
}
```

TITLE: Coercion in Angular Input Setter - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Update the setter in the 'SubmitButton' class to coerce input values to a boolean, accepting either a boolean or an empty string by using the static 'ngAcceptInputType_' prefix, accommodating broader input types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/cli/template-typecheck.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
set disabled(value: boolean) {
  this._disabled = (value === '') || value;
}
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
class SubmitButton {
  private _disabled: boolean;

  @Input()
  get disabled(): boolean {
    return this._disabled;
  }

  set disabled(value: boolean) {
    this._disabled = (value === '') || value;
  }

  static ngAcceptInputType_disabled: boolean|'';
}
```

TITLE: Using @defer with 'hydrate never' to Prevent Initial Hydration (Angular HTML)
DESCRIPTION: This Angular HTML template snippet illustrates the `@defer` block with the `hydrate never` trigger combined with a regular `on viewport` trigger. `hydrate never` prevents the initial hydration of the `<large-cmp />` and its entire subtree after server-side rendering, treating it as static content initially. However, the regular `on viewport` trigger still applies for subsequent client-side rendering or navigation, loading the component when it enters the viewport in those scenarios.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/incremental-hydration.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: angular-html
CODE:
```
@defer (on viewport; hydrate never) {
  <large-cmp />
} @placeholder {
  <div>Large component placeholder</div>
}
```

TITLE: RxJS Integration with Zone.js
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript example demonstrating how RxJS is patched to run in the correct zone. This shows Observable creation, subscription, and operators each running in their respective zones.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/zone.js/NON-STANDARD-APIS.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```
const constructorZone = Zone.current.fork({name: 'constructor'});
const subscriptionZone = Zone.current.fork({name: 'subscription'});
const operatorZone = Zone.current.fork({name: 'operator'});

let observable;
let subscriber;

constructorZone.run(() => {
  observable = new Observable((_subscriber) => {
    subscriber = _subscriber;
    console.log('current zone when construct observable:', Zone.current.name); // will output constructor.
    return () => {
      console.log('current zone when unsubscribe observable:', Zone.current.name); // will output constructor.
    };
  });
});

subscriptionZone.run(() => {
  observable.subscribe({
    next: () => {
      console.log('current zone when subscription next', Zone.current.name); // will output subscription.
    },
    error: () => {
      console.log('current zone when subscription error', Zone.current.name); // will output subscription.
    },
    complete: () => {
      console.log('current zone when subscription complete', Zone.current.name); // will output subscription.
    },
  });
});

operatorZone.run(() => {
  observable.map(() => {
    console.log('current zone when map operator', Zone.current.name); // will output operator.
  });
});
```

TITLE: Demonstrating Upward-Only Dependency Walk and Error Handling - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet exemplifies DI resolution's upward-only walk in the injector tree; if a dependency is provided only in a child, attempts to resolve from the parent injector throw a NoProviderError. Inputs: Car binding in parent, Engine binding in child. Outputs: error when trying to get Car from parent, as Engine is unavailable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/docs/di/di.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
var parent = Injector.resolveAndCreate([Car]);
var child = parent.resolveAndCreateChild([
  bind(Engine).toClass(TurboEngine)
]);

parent.get(Car); // will throw NoProviderError
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Zone.current.fork({ name: 'child' }).run(() => {
  document.body.onclick = () => {
    console.log(Zone.current); // <root>
  };
});
```

TITLE: Scope Sharing with Angular Inputs
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates scope sharing issues in Angular components using signal inputs, demonstrating how signal inputs are shared within the component scope to trigger certain functions without redundancies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden_best_effort.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// tslint:disable

import {input} from '@angular/core';

export class TestCmp {
  readonly shared = input(false);

  bla() {
    const shared = this.shared();
    if (TestCmp.arguments) {
      this.someFn(shared);
    } else {
      shared.valueOf();
    }

    this.someFn(shared);
  }

  someFn(bla: boolean): asserts bla is true {}
}
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/creating-component-harnesses.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Directive({
  selector: 'my-menu-item'
})
class MyMenuItem {}

@Component({
  selector: 'my-menu',
  template: `
    <my-popup>
      <ng-content></ng-content>
    </my-popup>
  `
})
class MyMenu {
  triggerText = input('');

  @ContentChildren(MyMenuItem) items: QueryList<MyMenuItem>;
}
```

TITLE: Demonstrating Hydration Node Mismatch in Angular Component
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a pattern that triggers hydration mismatch errors by directly manipulating the DOM outside of Angular's control. The component uses direct DOM manipulation to insert a new paragraph element before the first child of the host element.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/errors/NG0500.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Component({
  selector: 'app-example',
  template: '<div><span>world</span></div>',
})
export class ExampleComponent {
  hostElement = inject(ElementRef).nativeElement;

  ngOnInit() {
    // Create a new <p> element with the `Hello` text inside
    const newNode = document.createElement('p');
    newNode.innerHTML = 'Hello';

    // Insert the <p> before the first element. Since Angular has no information
   // about the <p> element, it will be looking for the <div> element at the first
   // element position instead. As a result, a hydration mismatch error would be
   // thrown. Instead, update component's template to create the <p> element.
   this.hostElement.insertBefore(newNode, this.hostElement.firstChild);
 }
}
```

TITLE: Illustrating Angular ngTemplateOutletContext Strictness
DESCRIPTION: Shows a template using `ngTemplateOutletContext` that now produces a compile error due to stricter type checking. The context object's type must now match the template context type exactly, preventing extra properties not defined in the interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface MyContext {
  $implicit: string;
}

@Component({
  standalone: true,
  imports: [NgTemplateOutlet],
  selector: 'person',
  template: `
    <ng-container
      *ngTemplateOutlet="
        myTemplateRef;
        context: { $implicit: 'test', xxx: 'xxx' }
      "></ng-container>
  `,
})
export class PersonComponent {
  myTemplateRef!: TemplateRef<MyContext>;
}
```

TITLE: Object Expansion with Input Signals
DESCRIPTION: Component demonstrating different patterns of object destructuring with input signals
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Component({})
export class ObjectExpansion {
  readonly bla = input<string>('');

  expansion() {
    const {bla: blaInput} = this;
    const bla = blaInput();
    bla.charAt(0);
  }

  deeperExpansion() {
    const {bla} = this;
    const {charAt} = bla();
    charAt(0);
  }

  expansionAsParameter({bla: blaInput} = this) {
    const bla = blaInput();
    bla.charAt(0);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing the Lightweight Injection Token Pattern in Angular (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code demonstrates the lightweight injection token pattern. An abstract class `LibHeaderToken` serves as the token. `LibHeaderComponent` extends this token and provides itself using `{provide: LibHeaderToken, useExisting: LibHeaderComponent}`. `LibCardComponent` now uses `@ContentChild(LibHeaderToken)` to query for the child, breaking the direct reference to `LibHeaderComponent` and enabling tree-shaking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/lightweight-injection-tokens.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
abstract class LibHeaderToken {}

@Component({
  selector: 'lib-header',
  providers: [
    {provide: LibHeaderToken, useExisting: LibHeaderComponent}
  ]
  â€¦,
})
class LibHeaderComponent extends LibHeaderToken {}

@Component({
  selector: 'lib-card',
  â€¦,
})
class LibCardComponent {
  @ContentChild(LibHeaderToken) header: LibHeaderToken|null = null;
}
```

CODE:
```
import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
import { HeroTaxReturn } from './hero';
import { HeroesService } from './heroes.service';

@Injectable()
export class HeroTaxReturnService {
  private currentTaxReturn!: HeroTaxReturn;
  private originalTaxReturn!: HeroTaxReturn;

  private heroService = inject(HeroesService);

  set taxReturn(htr: HeroTaxReturn) {
    this.originalTaxReturn = htr;
    this.currentTaxReturn  = htr.clone();
  }

  get taxReturn(): HeroTaxReturn {
    return this.currentTaxReturn;
  }

  restoreTaxReturn() {
    this.taxReturn = this.originalTaxReturn;
  }

  saveTaxReturn() {
    this.taxReturn = this.currentTaxReturn;
    this.heroService.saveTaxReturn(this.currentTaxReturn).subscribe();
  }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Zone.js Unpatched Events in HTML Head
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure Zone.js to leave specific events unpatched by setting up __Zone_ignore_on_properties and __zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS in the HTML head before loading Zone.js.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/zone.js/STANDARD-APIS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<head>
  <script>
    // Disable patching `on` properties for the following targets:
    const targets = [
      window,
      Document.prototype,
      HTMLBodyElement.prototype,
      HTMLElement.prototype,
    ];

    // This is declared without `let` or `const`, so it will become a property
    // of the global `window` object:
    __Zone_ignore_on_properties = [];

    // For the following targets, the `onscroll` property will not be patched.
    // Therefore, when using `window.onscroll = () => {}`, the callback will
    // always be invoked inside the root zone, because the implementation is not
    // patched and the task is not tracked for the current target:
    targets.forEach((target) => {
      __Zone_ignore_on_properties.push({
        target: target,
        ignoreProperties: ['scroll'],
      });
    });

    // When calling `addEventListener` with the `scroll` event, `zone.js` will
    // invoke the native browser `addEventListener` implementation immediately:
    __zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS = ['scroll'];
  </script>
</head>
```

TITLE: Creating Custom Type Definitions for Third-Party Libraries in Angular
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a custom type definition file for a third-party library that doesn't have TypeScript definitions available. This example creates an interface for a hypothetical 'host' module with parsing capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/libraries/using-libraries.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
declare module 'host' {
  export interface Host {
    protocol?: string;
    hostname?: string;
    pathname?: string;
  }
  export function parse(url: string, queryString?: string): Host;

```
TITLE: Temporary Variable Usage with Angular Inputs
DESCRIPTION: An implementation demonstrating temporary variable manipulation within Angular components, handling inputs dynamically and directing console outputs based on input value conditions using signal inputs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden_best_effort.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// tslint:disable

import {Directive, input} from '@angular/core';

export class OtherCmp {
  readonly name = input(false);
}

@Directive()
export class MyComp {
  readonly name = input('');
  other: OtherCmp = null!;

  readonly scroller = input({ fn: () => { }, other: (x?: any) => { } });

  click() {
    const name = this.name();
    if (name) {
      console.error(name);
    }

    const nameValue = this.other.name();
    if (nameValue) {
      console.error(nameValue);
    }
  }

  onOverlayAnimationStart() {
    if (global) {
      console.log('some statements');
      console.log('some statements');

      const scroller = this.scroller();
      if (window) {
        scroller?.fn();
        scroller.other();
      }
      if (window) {
        scroller?.other(true as any);
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------
```

```
TITLE: Handling Version Updates with SwUpdate in Angular
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the SwUpdate service to handle different types of version update events in an Angular application. It subscribes to the versionUpdates observable and logs different events such as version detection, installation, and failures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/ecosystem/service-workers/communications.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
@Injectable()
export class LogUpdateService {
  constructor(updates: SwUpdate) {
    updates.versionUpdates
      .pipe(tap(evt => {
        switch (evt.type) {
          case 'VERSION_DETECTED':
            console.log(`Downloading new app version: ${evt.version.hash}`);
            break;
          case 'VERSION_READY':
            console.log(`Current app version: ${evt.currentVersion.hash}`);
            console.log(`New app version ready for use: ${evt.latestVersion.hash}`);
            break;
          case 'VERSION_INSTALLATION_FAILED':
            console.log(`Failed to install app version '${evt.version.hash}': ${evt.error}`);
            break;
        }
      }))
      .subscribe();
  }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing File Copy Builder Logic in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Implements the logic for a custom builder that copies a file from a source to a destination, using NodeJS fs.promises.copyFile() and handling errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/cli/cli-builder.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BuilderOutput, createBuilder } from '@angular-devkit/architect';
import { promises as fs } from 'fs';

export default createBuilder(async (options, context) => {
  try {
    await fs.copyFile(options.source, options.destination);
    return { success: true };
  } catch (e) {
    return {
      success: false,
      error: `Error copying file: ${e.message}`
    };
  }
});
```

TITLE: Writing a Benchmark Driver using WebDriver in JavaScript

SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/benchpress/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// A runner contains the shared configuration
// and can be shared across multiple tests.
var runner = new Runner(...);

driver.get('http://myserver/index.html');

var resetBtn = driver.findElement(By.id('reset'));
var fillBtn = driver.findElement(By.id('fill'));

runner.sample({
  id: 'fillElement',
  // Prepare is optional...
  prepare: () {
    resetBtn.click();
  },
  execute: () {
    fillBtn.click();
    // Note: if fillBtn would use some asynchronous code,
    // we would need to wait here for its end.
  }
});

                        other {animals}

```
TITLE: Using contentChildren for Multiple Results Content Query in Angular
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the contentChildren function to query for multiple child components in the component's content. It shows how to access the query results in a computed property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/queries.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: angular-ts
CODE:
```
@Component({
  selector: 'custom-menu-item',
  /*...*/
})
export class CustomMenuItem {
  text: string;
}

@Component({
  selector: 'custom-menu',
  /*...*/
})
export class CustomMenu {
  items = contentChildren(CustomMenuItem);
  itemTexts = computed(() => this.items().map(item => item.text));
}

@Component({
  selector: 'user-profile',
  template: `
    <custom-menu>
      <custom-menu-item>Cheese</custom-menu-item>
      <custom-menu-item>Tomato</custom-menu-item>
    </custom-menu>
  `
})
export class UserProfile { }

```
CODE:
```

<button id="measure" onclick="measure()">Measure document.createElement</button>
<script>
  function measure() {
    console.time('createElement*10000');
    for (var i=0; i<10000; i++) {
      document.createElement('div');
    }
    console.timeEnd('createElement*10000');
  }
</script>

```
TITLE: Handling Builder Output with Logger in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Logger API from the BuilderContext to provide additional context and logging for the file copy operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/cli/cli-builder.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BuilderOutput, createBuilder } from '@angular-devkit/architect';
import { promises as fs } from 'fs';

export default createBuilder(async (options, context) => {
  context.logger.info(`Copying ${options.source} to ${options.destination}`);
  try {
    await fs.copyFile(options.source, options.destination);
    context.logger.info('File copied successfully');
    return { success: true };
  } catch (e) {
    context.logger.error(`Error copying file: ${e.message}`);
    return { success: false, error: e.message };
  }
});
```

TITLE: Incorrect Numeric Property Name in Provider Use Value - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates an error scenario where a number is used directly as a property name within an object literal for Angular's provider useValue. Angular and TypeScript expect property names to be strings in metadata expressions. Using a non-string numeric property name will trigger a compiler error. This illustrates invalid object keys in provider configuration.

LANGUAGE: typescript
```

```
TITLE: Disabling Prebundling in Angular Dev Server (JSON Configuration)
DESCRIPTION: Disables the Vite prebundling behavior for all dependencies in the Angular development server configuration. This setting resides within 'angular.json' under the 'serve' target options. Setting 'prebundle' to false will skip the prebundling process completely, potentially increasing rebuild times but sometimes necessary for compatibility. Use this with caution, as dependency rebuilds will occur more frequently.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/cli/build-system-migration.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
    "serve": {
      "builder": "@angular/build:dev-server",
      "options": {
        "prebundle": false
      },
```

TITLE: Reporting Progress in Custom Builder
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use context.reportProgress() and context.reportStatus() to provide progress and status updates during the builder execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tools/cli/cli-builder.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BuilderOutput, createBuilder } from '@angular-devkit/architect';
import { promises as fs } from 'fs';

export default createBuilder(async (options, context) => {
  context.reportStatus(`Copying ${options.source} to ${options.destination}`);
  try {
    await fs.copyFile(options.source, options.destination);
    context.reportStatus('Done.');
    return { success: true };
  } catch (e) {
    context.reportStatus('Failed.');
    return { success: false, error: e.message };
  }
});

    };
    styles: AnimationStyleMetadata;
}

// @public
export interface AnimationStyleMetadata extends AnimationMetadata {
    offset: number | null;
    styles: '*' | {
        [key: string]: string | number;
    } | Array<{
        [key: string]: string | number;
    } | '*'>;
}

// @public
export interface AnimationTransitionMetadata extends AnimationMetadata {
    animation: AnimationMetadata | AnimationMetadata[];
    expr: string | ((fromState: string, toState: string, element?: any, params?: {
        [key: string]: any;
    }) => boolean);
    options: AnimationOptions | null;
}

// @public
export interface AnimationTriggerMetadata extends AnimationMetadata {
    definitions: AnimationMetadata[];
    name: string;
    options: {
        params?: {
            [name: string]: any;
        };
    } | null;
}

// @public
export const AUTO_STYLE = "*";

// @public
export function group(steps: AnimationMetadata[], options?: AnimationOptions | null): AnimationGroupMetadata;

// @public
export function keyframes(steps: AnimationStyleMetadata[]): AnimationKeyframesSequenceMetadata;

// @public
export class NoopAnimationPlayer implements AnimationPlayer {
    constructor(duration?: number, delay?: number);
    // (undocumented)
    destroy(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    finish(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    getPosition(): number;
    // (undocumented)
    hasStarted(): boolean;
    // (undocumented)
    init(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    onDestroy(fn: () => void): void;
    // (undocumented)
    onDone(fn: () => void): void;
    // (undocumented)
    onStart(fn: () => void): void;
    // (undocumented)
    parentPlayer: AnimationPlayer | null;
    // (undocumented)
    pause(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    play(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    reset(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    restart(): void;
    // (undocumented)
    setPosition(position: number): void;
    // (undocumented)
    readonly totalTime: number;
}

// @public
export function query(selector: string, animation: AnimationMetadata | AnimationMetadata[], options?: AnimationQueryOptions | null): AnimationQueryMetadata;

// @public
export function sequence(steps: AnimationMetadata[], options?: AnimationOptions | null): AnimationSequenceMetadata;

// @public
export function stagger(timings: string | number, animation: AnimationMetadata | AnimationMetadata[]): AnimationStaggerMetadata;

// @public
export function state(name: string, styles: AnimationStyleMetadata, options?: {
    params: {
        [name: string]: any;
    };
}): AnimationStateMetadata;

// @public
export function style(tokens: '*' | {
    [key: string]: string | number;
} | Array<'*' | {
    [key: string]: string | number;
}>): AnimationStyleMetadata;

// @public
export function transition(stateChangeExpr: string | ((fromState: string, toState: string, element?: any, params?: {
    [key: string]: any;
}) => boolean), steps: AnimationMetadata | AnimationMetadata[], options?: AnimationOptions | null): AnimationTransitionMetadata;

// @public
export function trigger(name: string, definitions: AnimationMetadata[]): AnimationTriggerMetadata;

// @public
export function useAnimation(animation: AnimationReferenceMetadata, options?: AnimationOptions | null): AnimationAnimateRefMetadata;
```

TITLE: Handling Events Outside NgZone with Zone Check
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to handle events from a third-party library initialized outside NgZone, including checking whether code is running within the Angular zone.
SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/best-practices/runtime-performance/zone-pollution.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Component, NgZone, OnInit, output } from '@angular/core';
import * as Plotly from 'plotly.js-dist-min';

@Component(...)
class AppComponent implements OnInit {
  private ngZone = inject(NgZone);

  plotlyClick = output<Plotly.PlotMouseEvent>();

  ngOnInit() {
    this.ngZone.runOutsideAngular(() => {
      this.createPlotly();
    });
  }

  private async createPlotly() {
    const plotly = await Plotly.newPlot('chart', data);

    plotly.on('plotly_click', (event: Plotly.PlotMouseEvent) => {
      // This handler will be called outside of the Angular zone because
      // the initialization logic is also called outside of the zone. To check
      // whether we're in the Angular zone, we can call the following:
      console.log(NgZone.isInAngularZone());
      this.plotlyClick.emit(event);
    });
  }
}
```

TITLE: Angular Dependency Injection Logic Tree
```

<app-root @ApplicationConfig
         @Inject(AnimalService) animal=>"&#x1F433;">
  <#VIEW>
    <app-child>
      <#VIEW @Provide(AnimalService="&#x1F436;")
            @Inject(AnimalService=>"&#x1F436;")>
       <!-- ^^using viewProviders means AnimalService is available in <#VIEW>-->
       <p>Emoji from AnimalService: {{animal.emoji}} (&#x1F436;)</p>
      </#VIEW>
    </app-child>
  </#VIEW>
</app-root>
